intro: Desmoncus costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican starfruit, is a tropical plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and squash. The plant produces small, star-shaped fruits that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its vines climb using tendrils. It is often cultivated for its edible fruits and ornamental value.
